revised_title: Intramolecular Interactions and Self-Association in Alcohols
tldr: This study reports infrared spectra of various alcohols in the vapour phase, focusing on intramolecular interactions and self-association. The research identifies dimer absorptions for all alkanols and trifluoroethanol, and discusses the different behaviors of fluoroalcohols due to intramolecular hydrogen bonding. The findings provide insights into the self-association and hetero-association of alcohol systems.
